Message.Title: Yahoo made a nice recovery today.
Message.Msg: That is a good thing. But this board is getting trashed up again.

Message.Title: Yahoo Japan
Message.Msg: Surged 8% today. The current market value of Yahoo's stake in Y! Japan is now $7.16 billion pre-tax, or $4.7 billion after tax. In a cash-rich split, assuming a 20% discount, the value would be $5.7 billion. So Yahoo's stake in Y! Japan is currently worth between 25-30% of Yahoo's current market cap (and between 28-34% of it's current enterprise value). A successful sale of this stake would easily take Yahoo over $17.

Topic.Title: Yahoo Japan

Message.Msg: indeed, +7.98% !! Why ?

Topic.Title: Yahoo Japan

Message.Msg: Japan's most popular Internet portal boosted by ongoing ad revenue growth. Yahoo Japan Corp. said Wednesday that its net profit for the April-June quarter rose 7.6% from a year earlier on a continued increase in advertising revenue. The operator of Japan's most popular Internet portal site said its group net profit for the fiscal first quarter increased to Y25.09 billion from Y23.31 billion a year earlier. The company cited strong growth in advertising revenue on smartphones as one reason for the rise. Click here to find out more!For the three-month period, the company's operating profit increased 8.6% to Y42.16 billion from Y38.83 billion, while revenue rose 8.0% to Y77.60 billion from Y71.88 billion. The company said it expects its net profit to be in a range from Y51.99 billion to Y53.49 billion for the first half ending Sept. 30. Yahoo Japan is a unit of the Japanese mobile phone and Internet service company Softbank Corp., which holds a roughly 42% stake. Yahoo Inc. of the U.S. also holds a one-third stake. The company reports its earnings under Japanese accounting standards.

Message.Title: Marissa it is time to speak with the execs at Viringo VRNG pre trial with Goog over patents
Message.Msg: You know better than anyone what is at risk for Goog and Mark Cuban bought his1 million shares of VRNG for a reason. If Google really does owe billions to VRNG it would make perfect sense to gain by scale and start takeover talks with VRNG. They are battling with a list of companies but Goog is at most risk according to research. Especially since Old Lycos Tech is now merged into VRNG. Marissa you could use the tremendous windfall to buy back shares and own future royalties against Goog searchs and rewrite Yahoo's history and future! Seriously look into it! Good luck!
